title: JSON tags are not honored in case of allOf.

labels.name: model
labels.description: Related to swagger generate model command

body:
## Problem statement

JSON tags in generated models are different than strings specified in the swagger yaml spec. We are using allOf functionality of the swagger 2.0 spec. Noticed when using allOf, there are UnmarshalJSON() and MarshalJSON() methods are implemented for generated structs are having the JSON tag starting with capital letter instead of what is defined in yaml.

**Swagger spec:**
```yaml
definitions:
    Pet:
        type: object
        properties:
            name:
                type: string
                x-go-name: Name
                x-nullable: true
    Cat:
        allOf:
            - $ref: "#/definitions/Pet"
            - type: "object"
              properties:
                ability:
                    type: string
                    x-go-name: Ability
                    x-nullable: true
```
Now the Cat.go file in models directory has this UnmarshalJSON() method:

```go
// UnmarshalJSON unmarshals this object from a JSON structure
func (m *Cat) UnmarshalJSON(raw []byte) error {
        // AO0
        var aO0 Pet
        if err := swag.ReadJSON(raw, &aO0); err != nil {
                return err
        }
        m.Pet = aO0

        // AO1
        var dataAO1 struct {
                Ability *string `json:"Ability,omitempty"`
        }
        if err := swag.ReadJSON(raw, &dataAO1); err != nil {
                return err
        }

        m.Ability = dataAO1.Ability

        return nil
}
```
Is there a way to suppress this marshaller interface overriding methods from getting generated? We are using these models somewhere else in the implementation and we need "Ability" in the json tag in UnmarshalJSON() method starting with lower case 'a'.

## Environment
swagger version: 0.18
go version: 1.11
OS: Ubuntu
